dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 3317 EH: SAFE Act of 2017
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.official-title: To amend title 18, United States Code, to increase the penalty for female genital mutilation, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Stopping Abusive Female Exploitation Act of 2017 or the SAFE Act of 2017.

section.header: Increased penalty for female genital mutilation
section.text: Section 116 of title 18, United States Code, is amended by striking 5 years each place it appears and inserting 15 years.

It is the sense of Congress that States should have in place laws that require health care professionals, teachers, and other school employees to report to local law enforcement agencies any instance of suspected female genital mutilation.

attestation-group.attestation-date: Passed the House of Representatives December 5, 2017.
